bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to J. Martinez H., April 4, 1924

div1.p: Carter requests help in translating a section of a foreign book. He announces the completion of the third section of his book on the history of yellow fever.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to J. Martinez H., April 4, 1924
div1.opener:
Book
Martinez.
/LC
2121 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.,
April 4, 1924.
Dr. J. Martinez H.,
Dear Doctor Martinez:
div1.p:
May I again avail myself of your courtesy and knowledge
for the translation of the following extract: (Plates 103 and 104,
Gordon's Photostat of the Book of Chilam Balam of Chumayel? I,
with the Diccionario of Pio Perez, have translated it after a fashion--
i. e. imperfectly--but am not satisfied with my rendering.

When a letter or word is put in brackets: thus (k)(S)(L) it means
that I am not sure what the letter or word is.

“Uchinam Dios. Codz lic upach tan (S)(L) uhuyluum, lay tzoliob,
u cuch numya tu tan Cayumilti Ds: talel tun u cah yocol Christianoil;
lae: xekik--maya cimlal: Kintunyaabil (L) (S) akil haabil yx (Plate
104) pom kakil=Ucuch Numya= utzacicin=(sacpeta tahom canal= Elom
tecab=ychil Ox ahau Katun=hun ahau Katun=Ulobil Ox dzit Katun=
Bay dzibanil tumenel Evangelistos= y profeta Balam= talike chiuyumil
caan y luum=catukulem dzib tahob ah Kinob, tukinil noh Kintunyaabil
Lahun chable: Ych Christianoil ti cabinuluc Saul y Dn. An do (de?)
Martines Uchab utoh yal u mehe(
(de?)
-2-
Martines Uchab utoh yal u meh (e)(i) nob ahan tun caba=bay dzibanil
tu yal mah thanil Noh ah kin profeta Chilam Balam=y ti cal man ben,
Amen Jesus”----------

The above is preceeded by: “Haklay ukabash, dzibanoblae:--
1 Chilam Balam Noh aacerdote:
2 Napuc tun; Noh sacerdote,---
3 Hahau pech, Noh sacerdote---
4 Na-tzin-yabun-chan-Noh-sacerdote-- (and a line run through it)
4 Ah Kuil chel, Noh sacerdote;
5 Natzin yabun chan, Noh sacerdote,”

I have practically finished the Third Section of my History
and as soon as it is retyped will do myself the honor of sending
you a copy in order that I may have the benefit of your advice and
criticism before its publication.

I am sending this letter in duplicate, as I do not know whether
you are still in this country.

With highest esteem and continued gratitude for all your many
kindnesses, I remain
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
2121 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.
